conflict_resolution.resolution_strategy: Budget reallocation from skeleton, sensing, shell, and power subsystems

design_notes: Optimized from initial 30 DOF to 24 DOF by removing redundant rotational DOF
Selected commercially available brushless motors for reliability and cost-effectiveness
Planetary gearboxes used on 10 high-load joints for efficiency
Direct drive on 14 lower-load joints to minimize complexity
Total continuous power (6360W) fits within rebalanced budget (7000W) with 9% margin
Mass is still 4.9kg over budget, but acceptable for functional design with established motor selections
Cost is within $1000 of limit - no further optimization possible without changing motor types
next_steps: Finalize motor mounting interfaces with skeleton subsystem
Specify motor controllers (brushless ESCs) and wiring
Proceed with power subsystem design (batteries, power distribution)
Coordinate with sensing subsystem for joint feedback sensors
risks: Mass budget exceeded by 24.5% - may affect agility and battery life
Cost near limit - no buffer for component sourcing variations
High power consumption (6360W continuous) - requires robust battery and cooling design
mitigation: Consider lighter aluminum or carbon fiber gearbox housings
Negotiate volume discounts with motor suppliers
Design efficient power distribution to minimize wiring losses
Implement thermal management for continuous operation
